featured.text: And remember: never spend more than you earn.

Zoe was rather healthy when she was found, and once under the care of the orphanage she was very happy, consuming six gallons of vitamin-rich milk a day and earning a reputation as a confident, naughty and mischievous youngster.
They work from home and give all the money they earn to charity.
Around an old kitchen table, a young girl calls a family meeting to show her parents that they should earn more money so they can have nicer things.

definition.zh_def: 賺取，獲得（通常指金錢或報酬）
definition.en_def: To receive money or a reward in return for work or services.
definition.example: She works hard to earn a living.
